pros: Any healthcare organization is going to be challenging, but Cobble Hill is really dedicated to making sure their staff feels supported and has what they need to succeed. At the end of the day, it's all about amazing patient care, and with the resources and people here, we can actually do that.
cons: It's hard work....but that is healthcare.

pros: Healthcare is hard everywhere, but Cobble Hill continues to push through the challenges with the unification of the leadership team. Everyone is mission driven and has a "roll up your sleeves" attitude. The people work hard and truly want to make a positive difference in the world of healthcare.
cons: The industry is challenging, but this goes for everyone in healthcare!

job_title: RN SUPERVISOR CURRENTLY in Brooklyn, NY
cons: No parking what so ever. Got a ticket second day working

job_title: Office Assistant in New York, NY
pros: Provides lunch and the staff members are friendly
cons: Not a lot of growth opportunities

pros: friendly and helpful team and efficient work flow
cons: None that I noticed so far

pros: Free breakfast lunch and dinner depending on your shift. Same food they feed patients. Only 8 hr shifts if you can even consider that a pro.
cons: Don't work here if you care to keep your license. The nurses are underpaid and overworked. They train you in how to get your work done the fastest so that you can get home. Which means you are signing for medication and treatments that were not done so you can go home. They don't pay you past the time you are scheduled for. They take out a lunch break that You aren't even able to take. They call u practically every day to come in because their workers call out and they are so short staffed. They don't pay you if you come in early for a meeting. They don't pay you if you clock out after your time scheduled due to huge workloads. They say it's your fault for poor time management. Yet everyone stays. They also don't drug test you when you are hired. So they clearly don't seem to take into account that the nurses handle narcotics. Shady!

review_title: Gives you a sense of purpose but gets depressing after a while.
pros: If you put your all into it, the patients and staff are very grateful. Even the patients's families are thankful. You get to learn a lot from the resident's lives. You get some autonomy in making decisions. There's a cafeteria with free food. and free icecream. Minimum wage for very easy work.
cons: There are patients dying and losing their senses. This gets depressing after a while. Some of the workers don't give residents the respect they deserve. They try to clock out at the very second work ends. The cafeteria food sucks. The job can get boring since it's the same thing everyday.

job_title: Certified Nursing Assistant in Brooklyn, NY
pros: Excellent place to work. You will learn a lot about nursing because you will work very close to the nurse and assisting with any that is hands on with the patient.
cons: The work is very, very hard.
